meanings.definition: To make someone or something become heathen.
meanings.sent1: She tried to heathenize her friend by introducing them to different customs.
meanings.sent2: The missionary was worried that the new culture would heathenize the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to heathenize the class if they didn't behave.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious book seemed to heathenize anyone who read it, changing their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse was said to heathenize all who dared to enter the forbidden temple.

meanings.definition: To adopt heathen beliefs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The explorer decided to heathenize and follow the customs of the indigenous tribe.
meanings.sent2: Some people heathenize after traveling to exotic lands and experiencing new cultures.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to heathenize when it started worshiping the sunbeam as a god.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious teenager chose to heathenize and rebel against the traditional values of their family.
meanings.sent5: The enchanted forest had a way of heathenizing visitors, making them forget their old beliefs.
